key_risks: Legal and regulatory issues including DOJ settlement and ongoing regulatory scrutiny

governance_issues: Compliance practices and regulatory oversight concerns

sources.title: Washington Trust Announces Settlement with U.S. Department of Justice
sources.snippet: The Washington Trust Company ("Washington Trust" or "the Bank"), the wholly owned subsidiary of Washington Trust Bancorp, Inc. (Nasdaq: WASH), today announced that it has entered into a settlement agreement with the U.S. Department of Justice ("DOJ") that resolves alleged violations of fair lending laws in Rhode Island from 2016 to 2021. The settlement does not include any civil monetary ...

sources.title: Washington Trust resets balance sheet as performance metrics slide
sources.snippet: Over a five-year period, Washington Trust has significantly underperformed its small-bank peers in the stock market. On Tuesday, WASH was trading at around $32, down 41% since 2020. In 2024, its value peaked in early November but fell again to reveal flat gains. The corporation's current market cap stands at around $612 million.
